message.content:
<<<api>>>: ArrayList.remove
<<<code>>>: for (int j = 0; j < persons.size(); j++) {
    for (int k = 0; k < volcanos.size(); k++) {
        if ((persons.get(j).getXCoordPerson()) == (volcanos.get(k).getXCoordVolcano())
                && (persons.get(j).getYCoordPerson()) == (volcanos.get(k).getYCoordVolcano())
                && (volcanos.get(k).getEruptionStatus() == true)) {
            persons.remove(j);
            j--; // decrement j to account for the removed element
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: To remove a specific person from the persons ArrayList, you can use the ArrayList.remove method. In this case, when a person is located at the same cell as an erupting volcano, you can call persons.remove(j) to remove that person from the list. Since you are iterating over the persons ArrayList using a for loop, you need to decrement the loop variable j by 1 (j--) after removing the element to ensure that you don't skip any elements.
